ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: knowledge of a wide range contemporary painters, exposure to ways to approach art criticism, got to speak with working art critics in the industry, insightful conversations about topics pertinent to the discussion of painting and the art world in general right now

From this course I learned a new way of creative writing which served to critique and display opinions I have on certain artworks. I learned through this medium how to accept my own voice, my own opinions, and own confidence in my writing. I also learned the value of the audience and the sacred relationship between the writer and the readers. Mots importantly, I learned how to balance research and analysis with my own opinion and personality.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: material is AMAZING, prof. spillane is very knowledgeable and facilitates really insightful conversations about questions that had never crossed my mind before. detailed and helpful feedback on papers, super fun new york field trip in october, wonderful guest speakers. 

weaknesses: none, but this class is definitely more engaging if you are already even mildly interested in the material or have a bit of art background

The strengths of this course are its ability to push you out of your comfort zone. I feel as thought the prompts of the assignments and our ability to choose our own artworks and write in whichever way we felt with a clear argument prompted various discussions on the role of the critique. We were challenged to find our own voices in the hopes of influencing a certain perspective or notions on certain artworks and artists. But this was also simultaneously balanced with having to maintain moral discussions on the actions of individuals and the controversial visuals of artists.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes yes yes!! my favorite class of the semester, everything from the readings to discussions to field trips to guest speakers were just spectacular
Yesprofessors like Spillane are what we come to Yale for. If you ever plan to give journalism a shot, take the class.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student because of its ability to emphasize the importance of writing in the art world. I think if you have a thorough background in art historical analysis and writing, this course not only references art history but also aims to discuss the importance of cirques and wall text in the way such artworks have been perceived. It also poses a challenge to previous ways of writing about art, encouraging to dwell in one's opinion and try to understand simply why a work is not one's interest or a favorite.
